feed.title: I am too old for this (not)
feed.subtitle: Starting to focus on Ruby and RoR again. Some Swift on the side just because I seem to like it a lot.

entry.title: Use Jekyll they said!
entry.content:
For what is worth keeping a blog in Jekyll might sound easy. Posting pages in GitHub might sound even easier. But its not. Bootstrapping this blog for example took me some time to figure out as I wanted to have everything included. The whole battery pack. So I picked up a bunch of plugins, check a nice theme and modified it a bit. Locally everything started to work fine. Then it began to fall apart.

Sometimes I have to think small. I probably should use other platforms like medium to express. Well you cannot blame me for looking something closer to editor/git pair.

And there we are now.

Plain simple almost vanilla blog. For now.

Some nice guidance always found after a bunch of trials just to make Murphyâ€™s law worth something.
entry.summary: For what is worth keeping a blog in Jekyll might sound easy. Posting pages in GitHub might sound even easier. But its not. Bootstrapping this blog for example took me some time to figure out as I wanted to have everything included. The whole battery pack. So I picked up a bunch of plugins, check a nice theme and modified it a bit. Locally everything started to work fine. Then it began to fall apart.

entry.title: I am back!
entry.content:
Finally. It was time. It has been 18+ years in software development and 14 programming languages professionally used. The time has come to focus.

This will be my log on my daily adventures.

Enjoy. P
entry.summary: Finally. It was time. It has been 18+ years in software development and 14 programming languages professionally used. The time has come to focus.
